post_text: Jason Wilson, owner of Northwest Coffee Roasting Company, recently shared his business insights with KIPP St. Louis High School's Young Entrepreneur class. Jason's visit kicked off the 2020 Speaker Series, which brings prominent St. Louis professionals to speak to, and inspire, KIPP high school students. The session combined economics, business, sociology, and history -- and covered everything from the basics of good business practice to the origin of coffee cultivation in the Americas (coffee beans came over on slave ships from Africa). What a great learning opportunity for our KIPP students! Thank you, Mr. Wilson!

‚ú® KIPP Through College Spotlight! ‚ú®

De'Ja Wood, junior at Duke University, spoke in front of 2,000 people at a ceremony honoring Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. She had the opportunity to introduce Andrew Gillum, former Mayor of Tallahassee and nominee for Governor of Florida.

The theme for the event was "Power of the People", and De'Ja spoke about the the unrest in Ferguson in response to the killing of Michael Brown where "the people of Ferguson rose up in the name of Michael Brown and demanded a better nation for Black and Brown people."

We are really proud of our students for using their voice in activism and in the interest of building a better tomorrow for themselves and our country.
